message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I'm being asked to respond to a survey as a primary or secondary school teacher from Czechia about AI in education. I need to provide thoughtful responses based on the perspective of an educator.

Let me consider each statement:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is generally positive and I can see this as true based on practical experience. Many teachers use AI tools to help brainstorm and structure lessons. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is also realistic. AI can help personalize content and differentiate instruction. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - Similar to B, this is a real capability of AI in education. "Agree"

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs (multilingual learners, SEN) - This is true, AI can help with translation, text-to-speech, and adaptive learning for students with special needs. "Agree"

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - Definitely, AI can help with grading, attendance, organizing materials, etc. "Strongly agree"

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a concern with AI. Students could use AI to help plagiarize or cheat. However, this is more about misuse than what AI enables. I'd say "Agree" as it's a real concern.

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is true, AI systems can make mistakes and provide incorrect information. "Agree"

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a known concern about AI systems reflecting biases in training data. "Agree"

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a legitimate concern with data storage and security. 

For the remaining items, I need to consider data privacy risks and pedagogical concerns. Data security is a genuine worry when using AI systems in schools. As for pedagogical approaches, AI might recommend methods that don't fit specific classroom contexts or student populations, so that's also a valid concern worth acknowledging.
